definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: The antidote to the voices of doubt is to instead listen to the voice of God.
sentences.chinese: 對於那些懷疑的聲音，解藥就是聽神的聲音。

sentences.english: When the timer runs out the door will be locked forever, locking away the antidote inside it.
sentences.chinese: 到時門將永久被鎖住，解藥也會以後封存。

sentences.english: Itself is a lonely, but also make you feel lonely antidote.
sentences.chinese: 縝本身是一種寂寞，卻還要做你寂寞的解藥。

sentences.english: Is jealousy the antidote to cheating?
Make fox blunt thought I dont know even a study indicated no antidote.
sentences.chinese: 令狐沖還想着不知道平一指研究出解藥了沒有。

sentences.english: The only way to overcome it and walk out that door is to find an antidote.
sentences.chinese: 唯一擺脫的措施就是走出那扇門往找到解藥。

sentences.english: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming. Feedback is the treatment.
sentences.chinese: 樂觀是編程人員的職業病，而反饋則是解藥。

sentences.english: The medicine was provided by a sweet little waitress and her name was Desiree.
sentences.chinese: 解藥是一個叫德熙蕾的甜美可愛的服務生。

sentences.english: There is no known antidote for this poison.
But Drucker was more than just an antidote to status anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 但德魯克不僅僅是這些焦慮症狀的解藥。

sentences.english: Grief is itself a medicine. --William Cowper, Charity.
The boss still says he hasan antidote, however has to pay USD 1000.
sentences.chinese: 老闆還說他有解藥，不過得付1000美元。

sentences.english: In a new paper, Are Institutional Investors Part of the Problem or Part of the Solution?
sentences.chinese: 在新發論文《機構投資者是病因還是解藥？

sentences.english: So, what's the antidote to blaming?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，避免相互指責的解藥是什麼？

sentences.english: Don't worry, I have got the antidote in the exercise room.
sentences.chinese: 放心，我已經在練功房找到解藥了。

definition: good medicine/panacea/fig. a good solution/a good remedy (e.g. to a social problem)
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
lit. to prescribe the right medicine for an illness (idiom); fig. to study a problem to find the right way to solve it/to take appropriate steps
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
